name: Rajgir
description: An ancient city surrounded by seven hills, Rajgir was the first capital of the Magadha kingdom. Known for hot springs and the Vishwa Shanti Stupa.

name: Pawapuri
description: One of the holiest pilgrimage sites for Jains. This is where Lord Mahavira attained Moksha (liberation). The Jal Mandir in the lotus pond is iconic.

name: Bodh Gaya
description: The most sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site where Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree. Home to the Mahabodhi Temple.

name: Patna
description: Bihar's capital city with a rich history as ancient Pataliputra. Visit museums, historical sites, and experience urban Bihar.

name: Vikramshila
description: Ruins of another great ancient Buddhist university, established by King Dharmapala. A lesser-known but equally significant archaeological site.

name: Vaishali
description: One of the world's first republics. Important for both Buddhists and Jains. Features the famous Ashoka Pillar and ancient stupas.
